result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David L. Geimer

records.addlTxt:
Case called: 1:19 p.m.
Clerk: Nicole.   
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry. Defendant appears in person, pro se. 

**COURT QUASHES WARRANT**
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, defendant is competent to represent self,: a factual basis & defendant guilty;

State moves to amend COUNT 1 (Disorderly Conduct/Domestic Abuse) to Disorderly Conduct>>COURT GRANTS.

PLEA: 
COUNT 1 (Disorderly Conduct): NO CONTEST.

COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt on COUNT 1. COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 1 year for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to dismiss COUNT 1.

DEOJ RH>> 10/20/23 at 10:45 a.m.
Bond continues.

Adj: 1:28 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 9:34 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Defendant appears in person, pro se.

COURT QUASHES WARRANT. 

Court questions deft as to non-appearance.
Defendant makes statement, re: missed appearance. 
ADA McGarry is not requesting judgment at this time.
COURT vacates BFH, reinstates previous bond and conditions. 
Parties schedule with JA. 

Adjourned: 9:37 a.m.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $500.00

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 9:07 am 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft does NOT appear. 
Date and time was set for plea/sentencing hrg.  
COURT makes findings. 
COURT orders bond forfeited and authorizes $750 bench warrant. 
BFH>>9/23/2022 at 9:00 am. 
Adj: 9:08 am
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 9, 2022 at 08:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for David L. Geimer
Current: 512 Norton Street, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 08-17-2022)
Prior: 1015 Parcher Street, Wausau, WI 54403
Calendar call on August 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:07 am 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft appears in person, pro se. 
Date and time was set for plea hearing. 
State notes deft needs to complete ATTIC assessment prior to proceeding with plea hrg. 
Deft given plea paperwork to review and complete. 
CC set for 8/17/2022 at 1:00 pm to reset plea - deft may appear by phone. 
Adj: 11:08 am
Plea hearing on August 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury Trial on September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): C.M.G.; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police (Wausau PD) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 3rd party child exchange through the family resource center.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:03 pm 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant appears in person, pro se. 
Reading Waived. Court questions deft re: complaint and rights. 
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA: Not Guilty by Court. 

COURT ORDERS: $500 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): CMG. 
- Police (Wausau PD) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 
- 3rd party child exchange through the family resource center. 

BRANCH 3 CASE. 
PTC with JA: 6/1/2022 at 10:00 am. 
FPT: 7/28/2022 at 8:30 am. 
Jury Status Review: 8/30/2022 at 1:30 pm. 
Jury Trial:  9/8/2022 at 9:00 am.
